text:
Can someone help me out with the project setup,
I have cloned:

• ReinforcementLearning.jl
• ReinforcementLearningBase.jl
• <https://github.com/JuliaReinforcementLearning/ReinforcementLearningCore.jl|ReinforcementLearningCore.jl>
• <https://github.com/JuliaReinforcementLearning/ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl|ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl>
in the dev folder and am working on the source code there.

I am woking on ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl but the dependencies are not set up properly, Since RLZoo experiments can be called using ReinforcementLearning.jl, I imported it using "using ReinforcementLearning" after activating it which caused the following error.

ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package ReinforcementLearningZoo does not have ReinforcementLearningBase in its dependencies:
- If you have ReinforcementLearningZoo checked out for development and have
  added ReinforcementLearningBase as a dependency but haven't updated your primary
  environment's manifest file, try `Pkg.resolve()`.
- Otherwise you may need to report an issue with ReinforcementLearningZoo

And when I used ] resolve in the RL.jl source it added the dependencies in binary in .julia/packages. Whatever be the case I am not able to work with my cloned RLZoo.jl repo.

How to setup the dependencies so that it uses only the source code whenever I use the packages, so that I can work with it?

Btw, I am not really sure whether I missed it, but I think some good documentation is required for the developers so that they can set it up and start working on the source right away.

text: Alright, I got it fixed. Was stuck on this for a day and finally it seems to work.
